you can't be addicted to something you don't like, it's simple as that

call it conscious, or chemical response of the brain, or whatever, the fact stands: you like the thing you're addicted to.

The order is the difference. You perceive liking something because you are addicted, and the addiction claims that it can fill a void. You don't necessarily like it in an absolute fashion. You like it because of what it "could be."

-Smokers "like it" because it could offer social acceptance. That becomes a void replaced by the feeling of loss/withdrawal that comes when they stop, even if they realize it is far from socially acceptable.

-Alcoholics "like it" because it could offer social acceptance or an escape from depression. That becomes a void because the quality of friends lacks substance, and because it doesn't solve the depression. Then you begin drinking just because the alternative feels like it would be worse. (Keep in mind there's a difference between an alcoholic and a social drinker).

-People who abuse drugs initially do so either because of medical needs to relieve pain/a mental disorder, or because they like to experiment for "highs." This becomes a chemical dependence, and they continue to use because they don't like the withdrawal symptoms, which are quite severe.

-People who play a video game, initially do so because it is socially acceptable, something they foresee winning to some threshold, and they have an overvalued sense of skill. They continue to play, not because they "like" the game, but because they have financial investment from when they speculated they could "win," and because their logical brain still sees that silver lining as a possibility.

My primary account is Diamond II.
But..... I created smurfs.
I found out very quickly that my manner of playing a large sampling of champions, most of whom do not have reset kits, do not hold the strengths of actually smurfing in Season 7-8. They can play their roles, but just aren't as influential on winning as champs who can reset, and I can't split push when my team dies every 40 seconds, and I'm the only one alive.

So.... I set a goal. Get the smurf to gold reliably, and then I could just go play Norms/occasional diamond game. So far, I haven't been able to. I get occasional computer freezes that get me killed. I have a wife who likes to sabotage my weak multidimensional multitasking (living in the real world while also carrying). I have a son who randomly pounces me. And, then I have the usual in game feeders who make every game a solo carry or loss.

I keep thinking to myself: If I get all my accounts to Victorious skin level...... I can just ..... relax... be less toxic, and play games that don't matter.

That's my void I'm trying to fill. So far..... I've met that objective 6 times.
And each time, it put me so far into the IFS's crosshairs that shortly after reaching it, I got banned. Lost it all. Start over.

I can tell myself over and over that even THESE games don't matter, and I don't need to be toxic in them..... But you know..... who actually listens to themselves?
